title: Torsors of the Jacobians of the universal Fermat curves
abstract:
Let $m\geq3$ be an integer. We show that every torsor of the Jacobian of the
universal family of degree-$m$ Fermat curve is necessarily a connected
component of the Picard scheme. We show that the Jacobian of the generic
degree-$m$ Fermat curve has uncountably many non-isomorphic torsors. We give
some results towards the Franchetta type problem for torsors of the Jacobian of
the universal family of genus-$g$ curves over $\mathcal{M}_g$.
